comments.body:
Why this needs to be a pure virtual function ?
Not all data set, like the unbinned data set, needs to provide this functionality

I was already discussing the motivation for this in https://github.com/root-project/root/pull/8137#issuecomment-838795380. My main concern is that it's easy to forget to implement the correct `weightError` overload if the function is not purely virtual, forcing you to override it.

But okay, since there is some debate here and it's not really an important point, I'm happy to bring back the dummy function so this PR can be merged quickly to continue the developments on the RooFit data store classes.
Hi Philippe, thanks for the suggestion! I have implemented a templated C++-14-build compatible constructor that I put in every RooFit data class with a preprocessor macro. Is this okay now?
